title: setup-env.{sh,csh,fish}: load Lmod hierarchy
body:
`setup-env.{sh,csh,fish}` should load the Lmod module hierarchy instead of or in addition to the tcl hierarchy.

### Rationale

The upstream spack instance being used uses an Lmod module hierarchy to manage the environment. `setup-env.sh` unilaterally injects tcl modules into this setup; I would prefer to use Lmod to properly integrate with the upstream env.

It should be possible to disable tcl modules entirely, but I haven't figured out how to do this.

### Description

`setup-env.{sh,csh,fish}` would call `module use /path/to/Lmod/hierarchy` (or modify `MODULEPATH` directly) as part of setup. Whether to load in the Lmod or tcl modules should be configurable, through a flag to `setup-env` or some other mechanism.

Ideally, spack could generate modules for e.g. compilers, mpi, etc. of upstream spack instances that use the Lmod `inherit()` mechanism to inject the local hierarchy on top of the upstream one. See [this Lmod doc](https://lmod.readthedocs.io/en/latest/340_inherit.html) for an example.

### Additional information
This is related to #16730, but proposes a solution to some of the problems noted there besides additional documentation.

### General information

Spack is at `HEAD` (or nearly so) of `develop`.

```console
$ spack --version
0.16.1-2177-03e3a4e40d
```
